intro: Astragalus pauperiformis, commonly known as the poorform lappet, is a flowering plant species native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant is adapted to harsh, dry environments, with deep roots that help it survive in nutrient-poor soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects and small animals. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a species of conservation concern in some areas.
